ratings.comment: These other ratings are so harsh. John is a sweet old man he enjoys teaching and sometimes gets carried away because he is clearly very passionate about statistics. I love coming to lecture and hearing him teach. It is super beneficial and he will answer any questions in class and makes sure that students understand. 10/10 would recommend.

AVOID AT ALL COSTS. By far the worst teacher I have ever had. Disorganized. Unclear grading criteria. Overall unable to teach the material. The textbook was also no help. I tried to stick it out and teach myself but all of my other grades ended up suffering because of it.
This is the worst class of my undergrad. I dont understand how he received tenure. Logan is past his time and needs to go. He shouldnt be tenured nor should he be allowed to teach any class.

Trust me, avoid. It's not worth the stress, unless this is the only class you're in. He's a nice enough guy, but you have no idea what you need to know until days before the exam. More like a history class than a soc class. More memorization than analysis.
Good luck.

If you want a monotone professor who talks to himself in class and forgets the curriculum occasionally, then John is the right person for you. He's a great guy to talk to outside of class but he is not qualified to teach this class.

Terrible professor... I'm sure he knows the material but he simply cannot convey it to students. He's extremely rude to students all around and his lectures were absolutely cryptic. I would never take Logan again so please avoid at all costs.
I've always liked classes that challenge you. Professors who are actually the best challenge you to be a better person and a hard worker.  Well, because I'm actually normal

This is my second class with Logan and it's pretty awful. He's incredibly unclear and makes statistics a lot harder than it needs to be. On the plus side, with the textbook and a good TA you will be okay and be able to escape with a decent grade. I rarely go to his lectures and I still get A's.

Professor Logan is the best teacher I have ever had, his wit, knowledge, humor, and complete virtue stand him along the rest, I learned so much from his personality that you don't see from other profs. He has a unique style, those math guys are always a little quirky.

Professer Logan is an incredibly intelligent teacher who sadly has a hard time explaining his thoughts to the class. But his slides (which he wrote) are very comprehensive and are exactly what the tests are based on (so I never went to lecture). He is a great teacher if you utilize him and ask him for help, he's very willing to listen and help you.
Honestly the worst class I have ever taken at this University. What a disgrace. This man should be fired. But wait... He can't because he has tenure. This class made me want to drop out of college.

John Logan was one of the dullest professors I've ever had. He successfully turned a 100 person lecture into a 10 person class because no one wanted to come. His slides were unhelpful and lectures were very confusing. Assigns a lot of homework. Data analyses projects are long. Tests are all multiple choice and truefalse and are very tricky.

He didn't know our final paper had to be 20 pages-that's what he said on the first day of class and didn't remember that when a student asked him about it. On the LAST DAY of class he tells us 10 pages seems more viable. 10 AND 20 ARE VERY DIFFERENT! So absent-minded it makes me scared for my grade and knowledge of stats. HW takes ~20 hours/week.

Logan is literally the worst professor I have ever had. He would forget what he was supposed to be teaching us and assigned two huge projects right before the end of the semester because he forgot about them. Completely scatter-brained and gets off topic. Grades unreasonably hard. He needs to stop teaching.

No tests, just lots of homework and some quizes.  The homework was tough usually 4-6hrs+. The longest assignmnet was a 12 hour session, but no tests or exams. I learned statistics as well as some bsic STATA programming.   John is willing to take the time to talk with students after class and during office hours to further explain material.
very knowledgeable.  learned a lot. It is very useful if you want to go to graduate school.
This professor was the worst and least helpful person I've ever worked with. Change your major before working with him.

AVOID! AVOID! AVOID! If you don't have to take Logan DON'T. If you do think about changing your major! He is a horrible, horrible teacher. You will hate his class no matter how interested you are in it to begin with. Everything bad in the other reviews in completely true. This is my second class with him because I have to take the classes.
Mumbles so badly, moves way too fast.

like waking up in  a foreign country with out a berlitz guide. lectures are incomprehensible, tests are randomly generated. can be pretty rude to both students and ta, often without noticing. if you don't absolutely have to take this course from logan, do your self a favor, and run don't walk. shame too, because he has a lot to offer.

not a good professor! he can't explain some of his slides and often presents wrong information due to being disorganized.  makes everything seem harder than it is. mean to tas and other students. don't take stats 360 with him!

He is by far the worst professor i've ever had. If he's not giving us the wrong information, he's 'making it up' (which he willingly admits to doing). He is unbelievably rude and unkind, especially to his TA. I think that going to lecture sets you at a disadvantage because he makes ever concept 10x harder than it needs to be. Avoid him. He's awful!

dear god this man is so unclear. he's super intelligent but has no idea how to teach. grades? you won't know until the end, because he doesn't return things. books don't relate to material directly. he's willing to meet outside of class though, nice guy. just avoid him for classes. i did fine but others didn't.
By far the worst teacher I've ever had.

He says that just because you're a grad student you're not going to get an A.  He knows the material is hard in class and still continue to teach it in a way that does not ease up in explaining or clarifying things.
stats is tough and so is Logan. a power lecture is not a good idea especially with this guy. BORING. the first test was a breeze after that GOOD LUCK.
